website_summaries.verdict: More than just a sawhorse – this complete work station is hands down the best of the best for almost any task you want to tackle.
pros: Boasts a superior folding design with built-in clamp capable of handling up to one ton of force
Measures 39" x 39" x 34" with a 48" clamp capacity
cons: An expensive horse, but its quality and features far outpace the competitors

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I'll win the lottery and get a good unit sent to me: UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: The jaw for the movable side of the clamp is welded on crooked so the jaws aren't parallel when closed(see pics). Just opened it today and Amazon is sending me a new one.(Awesome return policy) It is always a crap-shoot ordering sight unseen for something of this kind of workmanship.. Hopefully I'll win the replacement lottery and get a good unit sent to me. This looks like it could be a great product if they paid a little more attention to the quality. Update 11/1/19 My replacement was welded correctly and I've been using this workstation for a couple of years and loving it. Hopefully they have straightened out their production problems by now.
customer_reviews.author: Pilgrim

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me. I had no idea what the heck it did but he said, "You need this.". Saw the box in the shop today and i opened it. In a matter of minutes, without even knowing what this thing was, i had it up and going. I LOVE IT!!! I'm making some carved lights and had trouble positioning them to work on all sides. Not any more with this thing. This jawhorse holds my projects perfect in all positions tight and it does not mar the up. Its sturdy and i need it to be. I totally recommend. Best thing i didnt know i needed...
customer_reviews.author: Barry S Crawford

customer_reviews.title: Great versatile stand
customer_reviews.text: I like this even better than I expected. It opens up really easy and is rock solid when you are using it. The foot pedal clamping is very handy for exact positioning of your workpiece using both hands. It holds the work really solid. When you are done, it takes seconds to fold up and roll away into a corner. I highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: KirkM

customer_reviews.title: Great DIY helper
customer_reviews.text: No real assembly required - nice. The build is good for the money and it grips whatever you need to be gripped...really well. Used it with a 2x4 clamped verticle to install a ceiling light. Great to have that extra pair of hands. It can seem like it doesn't work until you remember you have to lock it when you clamp, and if the foot pedal is inbetween rachets it will slip. The only real disappointment is the pads. They are good, but are not attached and have a tendency to come off. My model did come with the extra brace bracket for longboards.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Seamans

customer_reviews.title: Best shop tool yet
customer_reviews.text: My wife does a lot of wood crafts and uses full sheets of plywood to design-lay out and cut-paint her crafts. Was visiting a wood working friend and seen his..after he showed me what this jewel would do I ordered one for my wife's shop. I liked it so well I am ordering one for my shop as well...6 months from now hers will likely still look new as she takes care of her tools. In 6 months I should be able to update this with a durability review as I am hard on all my tools...It looks well made and I believe it will even stand up to me!! I hope!! Bob
customer_reviews.author: Robert Jernigan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent stable platform for many uses!
customer_reviews.text: I'm the amateur handyman for family, friends and neighbors. I've often been asked to cut down doors (both standard and ADA widths) to increase flooring or carpet clearance which can be tricky for a one-man operation, so I acquired this for that purpose. It's heavy but it folds up and is portable enough to carry in the back seat of my car. It's a rock-solid stable platform for door trimming and I've also used it for cutting sheets of plywood as well as other lumber. I've also used it to cut down logs that are oversized for my woodburner. Overall, very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: AAGuy

customer_reviews.title: Holy crap! This is one of those things that will ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because last summer I worked with a lot of large pieces of plywood. Don't buy this because it can support a piece of plywood. Buy it because it can support just about anything you need. I have been using it for all kinds of things, every day, and frequently wonder how I survived without it. Yes, it's that awesome. If you're reading reviews of this thing, you should just buy one.
customer_reviews.author: MaxPSI

customer_reviews.title: The Third Leg Will NOT stay in place from day one!
customer_reviews.text: Its been a few years since I purchased the Jawhorse but from the beginning one thing was perfectly clear. The third leg was perpetually lose. I thought this was some sort of user error but the more I read the more I find the same problem others have faced. I cannot recommend something built this fimsey. I've lost count how many times it has collapsed on me in the middle of work. For me its been nothing more than a very expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: texmaster

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a helping hand when working alone as
customer_reviews.text: Works great as a helping hand when working alone as I do. Beside its obvious use of holding pieces of wood, I use it as a stand for power equipment, which is securely attached to a base made of 3/4" plywood. I balance the equipment (e.g. router table, table saw, etc.) on the stand then secure it with the power jaws using the foot bracket. With the holding power of the jaws I have not had any experience of instability. When no longer needed it easily packs away in the corner of my very small workshop.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eskew

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool, although a little expensive
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed this tool. I have used it mainly to hold 2x4 or 2x6 and cutting or sanding the materials. It seems to be well built very practical and also has some weight on it. It comes with a bracket to where you can use a 2x4 to support 4x8 sheets of plywood or materials and be able to cut them without worrying too much about the 4x8s being too flimsy. I have had some issues while clamping the material but so far with about 10 hours of use I am really liking this tool. Has rolling wheels to make it easier to move(because it gets heavy after carrying with one hand).
customer_reviews.author: Jose Madera

customer_reviews.title: Amazon sent me somebody else's returned junk
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a rating of one because it simply didn't work out of the box. The ratcheting mechanism was faulty. I'm not sure if some other idiot broke it and then Amazon sent it to me? All the zip ties that were supposed to hold the legs in place while shipping were cut. This was obviously a defective return Amazon tried to pawn off on me. Now I have to drag my butt to a UPS store during the coronavirus epidemic. Will I die? Thanks Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Wagner House

customer_reviews.title: Tough, commercial quality
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a "one man show", this is my third hand and the second JawHorse I have owned. These are heavy, by necessity, and setting up does require some effort. But it pays you back in "aces", in allowing you to perform jobs you could never do yourself. As with all Rockwell Tools, the build is commercial, and is a lifetime tool.
customer_reviews.author: Claus

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy AND portable
customer_reviews.text: Just received. No instructions. You don’t need them. Intuitive setup and use. Mechanically simple = does exactly as advertised. After extensive research of this and the triton went with Rockwell on basis of reported better sturdiness, and better transportability. The two wheels make it easy to roll around (unknown was that you can extend the handle which makes it even easier to roll around). Folded footprint is a square foot - easy storage. Very happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good build
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 sheetmasters and I'm very happy with their build quality. They are heavy but not if you're used to a little lifting. Good clamping force and lock so far. Folds up and rolls easily once you do it a couple times. Registered for the 5 year warranty (pull the clamp back for S/N). For 206 bucks a piece, that's a fine deal.
customer_reviews.author: Serenity63

customer_reviews.title: I'm a little disappointed that one of the rubber pads keeps popping off--I ...
customer_reviews.text: All in all, so far it's a sold piece of equipment that is serving me well. I'm a little disappointed that one of the rubber pads keeps popping off--I keep finding it in the back of my truck. It's only a matter of time before it goes missing altogether. Also, the turn-screw handle for the single fold-down leg on the far end, is made of plastic...a little chintzy. In fairness though, the imbedded screw is in fact metal. If I could give it 4 1/2 stars, I would.
customer_reviews.author: Rynoceros

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant Design
customer_reviews.text: This thing's a beast yet very creatively designed. It folds up into a small size for carrying but is very sturdy and stable when unfolded. The clamping force is generated by your foot, so it holds stuff in place very securely. I'd buy one again if I ever have the need.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph K

customer_reviews.title: Good, but arrived with Mfg defect
customer_reviews.text: Strong, well-built, and worked as advertised. Excellent packaging, unit arrived in great condition. However, I can't give it five stars because the unit had welding on it that prevented the expansion piece from sliding easily---in certain positions it would completely lock up. If your unit is not smooth, look at the welding underneath the sliding piece. In my case, I had to very carefully use a carbide grinder to remove the excess welding formation. Took a while to figure out what the problem was, but an easy fix if you know what to look for. Otherwise, unit performs as intended!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Vallejos

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tool, should have bought long time ago.
customer_reviews.text: Why did I ever wait so long before finally buying this tool.! What a workhorse. Aptly named too. I love it. When usually working alone, a spare set of hands is not handy and for that matter, a person cannot hold an object like the jaw horse can. It is rock solid with the grip. Highly highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: gkk2001

customer_reviews.title: This has become my second hand in my workshop
customer_reviews.text: I am disabled and do not have full use of my left side and the Jawhorse has become indispensable for me in every day life, in fact, I wish I could afford 2 more. I use it to support and hold my work pieces, and it is heavy enough to absorb the vibrations so I don't have to, since they can cause me pain, while easy enough to move around that I can move from project to project.
customer_reviews.author: RJ M.

customer_reviews.title: YEE HAW!!!  I finally got me one of these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been jonesing for one of these for years, now I have one. And, it was less expensive to get the Sheetmaster than the JawHorse with plywood attachment. As to the wheels being difficult to use, I don't know what the people who say this are talking about. Due to a car accident that has left me injured in one shoulder and a heart surgery gone awry (still hasn't healed after almost 4 years....that's another story), I am fairly weak in my arms. The wheels are a God send for moving this beast around. Now, if I can just con somebody to help me put up a roof over my entry porch..........
customer_reviews.author: brother bruno

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite tools in my garage.
customer_reviews.text: One of the most useful tools I have ever purchased. I was skeptical until I used the smaller version at my fathers and when I saw they had one that would hold full sheets I had to have it. It looks like a goofy tool, But it is that extra set of clamps or hands for the project that are always seem to be needed and this provides them
customer_reviews.author: Billvis

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for door making
customer_reviews.text: I really like the capabilities of this workstation; I can clamp a door on edge for machining, it makes a great gluing clamp for assembly, and it has sufficient mass to handle heavy doors easily.
customer_reviews.author: kitchen_guy

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't imagine not owning one.
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine now for 4 yrs. From welding square tubing to cutting boards, ive have used the heck out of mine. It is my go to vice. Will it clamp like a 6" vice, not really, but from i have used it for, its worked great. I bought this model for my brother in law who has been a huge help to my wife and i as he remodel our bedrooms and bathrooms. Our current project, ive been using my jawhorse every weekend again and still working flawlessly. In my top 3 best tools in my garage for sure!
customer_reviews.author: CJM515

customer_reviews.title: I'd give 6 stars if I could!  Absolutely love the Sheetmaster.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give 6 stars if I could! Absolutely love the Sheetmaster. Definitely get this one as it'll handle a full 4x8' sheet of plywood and YES IT DOES HOLD without any wiggle wobble. Word of advice: when unlatching the locking mechanism, you have to push the locking/release pedal from straight on and not from the side. Else the latching mechanism won't work properly. Folds easy and out of the way which is why I bought this thing.
customer_reviews.author: B. Kim

customer_reviews.title: I love this JawHorse but Ive got to give it 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this JawHorse but Ive got to give it 3 stars due to its weight. This thing is a TANK. And for the weight and size the wheels are drastically too small. Doesn't roll in gravel, dirt, or sand at all so basically if your not on a shop floor you are carrying it. It does work great for what it does but being a mobil tool it is not.
customer_reviews.author: real.

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy, lacks good handle to drag it. Clamping Function works well though.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast but moving it is not as easy as it should be. It's not just that it's heavy. There's not a good way to hold onto it when dragging it on its little wheels. You know how a two wheel dolly has a sturdy handle to hold on to? Not this thing. If I had known how cumbersome it is to move, I would have got the smaller model.
customer_reviews.author: Plant Whisperer

customer_reviews.title: A must have helper.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty an well thought out. I do most of my home construction projects by myself. The JawHorse has been indispensable. It cuts down time on tasks and makes tasks safer by steadily holding materials in place. Note: The JawHorse is heavy. It has small wheels which is good on smooth surfaces but you might need to use some muscle to carry it on gravel or dirt.
customer_reviews.author: Baja

customer_reviews.title: Impressive, quality and high end Jaw Horse.
customer_reviews.text: Both very heavy and heavy duty. Works great once set up... amazing construction, trustworthy piece of gear. Feels like it weights 10,000 pounds. Maybe if I was a hefty tradesman it wouldn't feel so heavy, LOL. But all in all, great product. As advertised. Impressed. Probably better for leaving set up at home, in the garage or a long stay at a jobsite... Wouldn't want to haul this around daily.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Fox

customer_reviews.title: It’s nice but costs too much
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to help with plywood with my bad back. It holds it amazingly well and holds it tight and sturdy. But it’s a pain to fold and unfold and set up with a bad back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A stand up piece of equipment that will last.
customer_reviews.text: Listen, you're just not going to find a more useful piece of equipment that will stand up to daily use. I've had em all and this one is like having another person there to help.
customer_reviews.author: Devin C Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have companion for your workshop. Once you get the hang of setting it up and using it, it can be an invaluable tool. I've only had this for a few weeks and I've used it as a pair of second hands to cut the bottom off a door as well as holding large or long items like my weed eater so I could work on it much more easily. I definitely would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Vykon

customer_reviews.title: First unit doest work.
customer_reviews.text: The leverage portion appears to work but the ratcheting teeth will not catchor apply pressure. Will attempt to exchange. Questionable quality control at best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Portable and versatile work bench that saves space
customer_reviews.text: Great horse to have when you're on the go. Use it as a vice, sawhorse, work bench, third hand, and more! Transforms into a more compact form and comes with wheels when you want to store or move it around. Love this thing so much.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: The third hand we always need
customer_reviews.text: Great product. The third hand we always need. Heavy duty. Folds up for easy storage
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought sooner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item for those in the shop that need an extra pair of hands. It is extremely sturdy and comes with a metal clamp to make an extra support from 2x4 product for working with sheets of plywood. You just cut two to length and clamp. The jaw mechanism works extremely smooth and really has the holding force advertised. Folds up easily and leg system evenly distributes weight. Do yourself a favor and do not spend your money on one of those cheaper products, save up and buy this in the first place and do not make the same mistake I have in past. This one really lives up to it's reputation.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman 3207

customer_reviews.title: Best decision I ever made!
customer_reviews.text: This clamping horse is a beast! used this as a miter saw station, table saw station, workbench station, and others interchangeably. Easy to carry from garage to the jobsite with it's compact folding design and built-in casters.
customer_reviews.author: Jayson

customer_reviews.title: Received a used product
customer_reviews.text: I just unboxed it today and haven’t used it yet but it was marred on several surfaces. It looks like I have received a lightly used product.
customer_reviews.author: Waddamelon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a beast of a tool. I do a lot of work by myself so it's helpful to have this too nearby on the farm.
customer_reviews.author: yorgee

customer_reviews.title: ***UPDATE*** Bought almost a year ago and have been impressed ...
customer_reviews.text: ***UPDATE*** Bought almost a year ago and have been impressed. Thought it was gimmicky but it proved very handy. Only issue, recently it started to stick nearly completely extended AND when nearly fully closed. It will clamp but I need a rubber mallet to move it at the extremes. It is not been dropped or bent. Dropped to three stars for this issue. Will update back to 5 if a fix is available.
customer_reviews.author: DJ Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: OK, but problems
customer_reviews.text: The jawhorse was well built but there is a dead spot where the jaws do not close regardless of how many times you pump it. If you are doing some work where you are trying to hold something in this area there are going to be problems! The jawhorse is too heavy to send it back so you just have to live with the problem.
customer_reviews.author: rbarch

customer_reviews.title: I wished I had bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: Great product so far. I wished I had bought it when I was building my shed. Jaw has a lot of holding power, it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Pedrini

customer_reviews.title: I received the product in good order, but there was no instruction manual in ...
customer_reviews.text: I received the product in good order, but there was no instruction manual in the box. There was a note on the box itself telling me to refer to the manual to know how to use the attachments included. I guess I'll be happy if they read this, and send me the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Bofus

customer_reviews.title: Must buy for any handyman
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. Where has it been all of these years? Sturdy, durable and holds everything in place as needed. Definitely a must buy for any handyman.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, love it, perfect tool for the job I was doing
customer_reviews.text: Started a project to put Pergo in my parents bathroom (maybe not the best choice) and had some wacky cuts to make. There place is small and they had no place to clamp anything. So having looked at this in the past I finally decided to try it. It is awesome. Easy to use, perfect tool for the job. Held everything I needed steady for using a circular saw, jig saw and belt sander. Can't wait for my next project. Oh and whomever at Rockwell thought they should put wheels on it is a genius. It is a bit on the heavy side but that is in no way a complaint, it is solid and feels very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Made all the difference between mediocre and great, painful and pleasurable, ambivalent and confident. This is one of the must have's if you're working solo.
customer_reviews.author: GGFlieger

customer_reviews.title: Strong but heavy
customer_reviews.text: The saw horse is a beast and can handle just about anything you clamp in it. But because it’s so strong is also heavier then you would expect to move around. And since most of the job sites I use it on don’t have pavement yet the small roller blade style wheels are pretty useless, I have to carry it. All around though it’s a good useful piece of equipment to have.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Solid platform for cutting
customer_reviews.text: This item works well. It folds up fairly easy and quickly. It is reasonably heavy so that it keeps things in place. Overall good item.
customer_reviews.author: Saleem Ali

customer_reviews.title: A Must for Every Garage Workshop
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool and it has transformed what I can do in my garage workshop. Highly recommend. Well worth the price. Sturdy, intuitive, functional. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Bert Caruthers

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Tool!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product, it is a must have. This tool has simplified my life.
customer_reviews.author: Armando martinez

customer_reviews.title: 10/10 would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! solid and reliable construction. I would definitely buy this again and I plan to add a second one in the future. Also, the color on product page looks yellow/orange but the sheetmaster jawhorse I received was Rockwell's green color.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Used this allot during a full Kitchen Remodel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to help make a full Kitchen remodel go smoother. It works GREAT accept for the plastic knob that broke on first use. The Clamp could be a little easier to use but once you figure it out all is good. It holds tight also. The main body is strong & sturdy. it stores neatly & very compact. Has wheels to roll around along with a leg that becomes a handle. I do plan on purchasing a second one so I have a pair
customer_reviews.author: Mcgyver210

customer_reviews.title: Still a great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty. Call mine "my little Britney" when my daughter is not here to help me. I have used it to hold a 6 x 6 fence post, cut plywood, and many other uses. Only problem I have is the awkward and heavy-ness of the unit. The wheels are almost worthless unless you are moving on smooth pavement. The wheels should be a little farther apart for more stabilization. Still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The best thing I’ve ever bought on amazon, it’s like having a piece of the space station :) solid, stury and reliable
customer_reviews.author: Hjy232

customer_reviews.title: Makes jobs much easier, should have got it sooner!!!
customer_reviews.text: It sets up easy and is secure in place, Used it for my first project and it made it so much easier, definitely glad i purchased it.
customer_reviews.author: Bill L.

customer_reviews.title: Extra pair of hands
customer_reviews.text: Awesome!!! An extra pair of hands. Wish I'd have bought this years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: great device.
customer_reviews.text: Would have given it 5 stars if not for the fairly flimsy plastic lock knob. Otherwise, great device.
customer_reviews.author: billie joe sanders jr

customer_reviews.title: Best one out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome portable vice and work stand. It is great with needing to secure large sheets of plywood or needing to securely hold things for fastening. It folds up fairly compact and can be stored in the corner of the workshop. I wish I had a second one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Bernese Mtn. Dog Mark

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as heck
customer_reviews.text: This thing grips like a beast. Be careful with fragile stuff. Its pretty darn near indescribable. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong and handy.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Super sturdy. A must if you do projects by yourself. It’s more than a third hand, it’s a strong work platform. I won’t leave home to do work without it.
customer_reviews.author: TAW

customer_reviews.title: Compact and hefty
customer_reviews.text: Still getting used to using this but it’s well made and compact when not in use
customer_reviews.author: RoseMarie Losi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I use it all the time. Plywood, table top, cutting, sanding. Heavy duty and perfect for the homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good clamp but i was hoping a small piece of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good clamp but i was hoping a small piece of plywood like 2×4' would be sturdy but its very flimsy
customer_reviews.author: lqs99

customer_reviews.title: Built like a tank
customer_reviews.text: This item needs the ability to post more stars! Built like a tank. I used to own a Rigid three leg pipe vice, that I used for portable vice tasks. This is much better. The price is way steep, but I waited till it was on sale, and I snagged it on cyber Monday for $150 shipped. That was a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Gary Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This sawhorse is built solid and it works great - I use it for every project I work on and I don't know how I got anything done before owning the JawHorse. The design is simple and the clamp is easy to use - and I use it all the time. The legs fold up so I can store it or move it around easily, but it is heavy. A great addition for on the go or everyday use in your workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Solohvs

customer_reviews.title: useful.
customer_reviews.text: When I use I think "I should have got it sooner." The tool is also strong and durable. I use it for a lot of outdoor and farm use and it has stood up to a lot of heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Smith

customer_reviews.title: works great as a "third hand"
customer_reviews.text: I use this cut all my wood for projects, works great as a "third hand", grips pvc pipe, endless uses. Grips so well, in fact, that you can over tighten and crush items with the foot pedal if you're not careful. Don't know how I did things before without it.
customer_reviews.author: Shinnosuke

customer_reviews.title: glad I got the one that can hold a sheet ...
customer_reviews.text: glad I got the one that can hold a sheet of plywood. Pretty well balanced. Doesn't take up to much space. Not tripping over it. Good job rockwell
customer_reviews.author: Bolduc Builders

customer_reviews.title: Buy it, you won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Buy it, you won't regret it...this tool is just TOO handy and works like a charm. I've got an original jawhorse and this one deploys and stores so much easier. Dual wheels work better than you might think so you don't have to lug around by hand as much over uneven ground. Well worth the extra money spent
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Crump

customer_reviews.title: perfection
customer_reviews.text: I can't imagine improving anything on this stand. Construction-wise, it is a BEAST--just can't imagine it ever failing me for what it's designed to do. The bits of plastic are more than adequate for the task, and they probably operate more smoothly than any other material would, so don't fret over that for a second. BRAVO to Rockwell for an amazing design.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W. Furer

customer_reviews.title: Rock solid clamping.
customer_reviews.text: Very handy tool for DIY work when you need a 2nd pair of hands. The foot pedal is such a good idea - it makes clamping effortless and fast. The product feels solid, and well made. For the small incremental price, go with Sheetmaster version. It's wider holding capacity is surprisingly handy for various projects. I didn't realize this, but the product also includes a separate device to clamp a couple 2x4's together to prop-up long pieces of wood. That was a nice surprise and delight. Why don't more companies go the extra mile?
customer_reviews.author: Scott Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Solid as a rock.
customer_reviews.text: I cannot believe I never purchased one of these earlier, what a time saver, takes a bit to get into it, but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A MUST HAVE FOR ANY HANDYMAN
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this Jaw Horse work incredibly well but it has made my day top day work much easier. It is easy to transport with the wheels on the base. IDK why but mine came in green, dont really care just strange.
customer_reviews.author: Julien

customer_reviews.title: Needed in every garage
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely the second set of hands. The tool is able to hold very small to very large pieces of wood, plywood, pvc pipe in order to cut, clamp or work on. Easy to set up and easy to move and store. Does not take up very much room when folded up. Definitely makes working by yourself much safer. Such a simple concept but it so useful. Much better than the typical saw horse.
customer_reviews.author: dackerman

customer_reviews.title: Versatile And Portable
customer_reviews.text: The JawHorse is a versatile tool that can be used to hold many different kinds of work pieces. Beside that, the JawHorse is highly portable. It should be the only workbench I'll ever need.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Peters

customer_reviews.title: Mostly Great
customer_reviews.text: Overall this tool is pretty great. The tool is quite heavy, but this is actually an upside, since it helps hold your work piece. The only negative is that thinner sheet material of 1/4" or less can slip under the vise faces and sustain damage. However, cleverly placing a couple pieces of scrap wood in the vise stops this. Also, the vise is flat on one side and L-shaped on the other. This means your piece will sit higher on one side, but it's easy to deal with. I clamp a large level to plywood to use as a guide for my circular saw as this tool holds the material and it works out great.
customer_reviews.author: edward hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: I clamped a 1/2 sheet of plywood and it was the best work station I could have asked for from de-boning ...
customer_reviews.text: This JawHorse is ideal for people that don't have a helper. This past sunday I was having trouble de-boning a deer prepping in for a manual meat grinder. With no help or a place to work on the body parts I unboxed my newly bought helper and made quick work of the animal. I clamped a 1/2 sheet of plywood and it was the best work station I could have asked for from de-boning to clamping my grinder on the plywood. It is heavy-duty, solid and you will enjoy the versatility it offers.
customer_reviews.author: sam sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very well built, with metal where it's needed and impact nylon where plastic is needed. Acts as my second pair of hands. The only negative thing I have to say at this point is that the wheels on the unit are too close together and when you wheel it around, the unit wobbles (it's heavy so wheeling it around is a nice option, but I find myself carrying it to deal with the wobble).
customer_reviews.author: Adam L Duquette

customer_reviews.title: Great for a small shop
customer_reviews.text: This has been very useful and it's built very well. It is very heavy though.
customer_reviews.author: Midnight Hoss

customer_reviews.title: functional but not the best
customer_reviews.text: The Rockwell RK9002 is a useful tool but I had a few issues with it. It is made of heavy steel. However one of the key parts, the locking nut that secures the back leg is plastic. It was cracked and trying to get a replacement part is a challenge. The metal slide also does not slide as easily as anticipated. At 53 pounds, I would not consider it portable for some. I plan to keep it since it is too bulky and heavy to return.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Wu

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but a light-weight couldn't do the same thing.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I won't give this 5 stars is because of the weight, but then again, the weight is part of what makes it work so well. So if there was the option, I'd give it 4.7 stars. It does as advertised. Only issue I've had with it is the legs flair out so wide--giving it stability--that I kicked my bare toe on the foot of it the first day I got it. Lucky for me I didn't need that toe for the rest of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Timot

customer_reviews.title: Holding on
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to my husband for a birthday present and won huge kudos from him and from his wood-working friends. The JawHorse works as advertised, folds conveniently and quickly became one of his go-to tools. Since we're in the middle of a huge remodeling project, it already has been tested to its limits earned great reviews from down in the barn.
customer_reviews.author: bkwrm

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t imagine ever doing with out one ever again. It is a very high quality and incredibly versatile tool!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Excellent clamp. VERY useful in my garage work shop. Built some barn doors for my house and these are great for clamping down on the tongue and groove I use for these doors. Keeps the door much straighter and tightee than the bar clamps I have always used. MUCH easier to set also.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Woody

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move and store
customer_reviews.text: Well built. Easy to move and store. This is a nice step up from the basic model.
customer_reviews.author: reader

customer_reviews.title: Life saver
customer_reviews.text: Wow - I have used this so many ways in the last week it is becoming silly. I bought this to use with my skill saw. I didnt yet have the money for a table saw, miter saw, etc. What a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: Rennie Pelkie

customer_reviews.title: You need this tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect tool for the D.I.Y person who works alone, you always need another arm or hand to hold something. This tool is the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I love this Jawhorse
customer_reviews.text: I love this Jawhorse. I sometimes use this too support a ladder, I feel a lot more secure then having a person hold the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: libs

customer_reviews.title: Extra hand
customer_reviews.text: Works great easy to use great having a extra hand
customer_reviews.author: Gus S.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: It arrive as promised everything worked out great but never gave it to much use is really heavy
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It's a vise/work stand and many other devises. Best investment I ever made for my work shop/garage!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: The helper that never disappoints!
customer_reviews.text: Bought the regular version first and now got this one for larger material. Its indispensable for DIY perfectionist like me that enjoys working alone and taking my time doing projects. The helper that never disappoints!
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: New toy
customer_reviews.text: Very well built I am having fun figuring out what all I can do with it. I feel like a kid with a new toy, whenever I use it.
customer_reviews.author: Blueduck

customer_reviews.title: Good Stable tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a good stable tool, I used it to clamp some pipe for cutting.....the jawhorse was rock solid in holding the pipe. The best feature is the mobility. I can now take the clamping vice where I need it, near my project, and do not have run back to my garage or basement to use a vice.
customer_reviews.author: Dansplace

customer_reviews.title: A super aid when a second person isn't on hand.
customer_reviews.text: I donated this to my parish so our sole maintenance man could do what would require two people under normal circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Mochni (Hopi: Talking Bird)

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job. I'd buy again
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty. Does a great job. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband's favorite item that I have purchased for him
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, well made, very helpful especially when I need an extra hand. I have 2 of these and I love them, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Janet K

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: holds plywood secure enough that can cut and route. bought another one and threw my saw horses away. Holds small and large pieces and is very heavy duty. I build a lot of cabinets and these are the right height and holds one large cabinet secure enough to use and a work bench
customer_reviews.author: bob dailey

customer_reviews.title: One of the best gifts ever
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mans birthday-He uses it almost daily, just wish I would have bought it earlier. I also got him the welding station, he uses it constantly. If I could give it 6 stars, I would. I highly recommend this product, just from the feedback I've gotten from him.
customer_reviews.author: P. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made well, user friendly, bit heavy, holds projects in place very well.
customer_reviews.author: Russ M

customer_reviews.title: If you have nobody to hold the other end or ...
customer_reviews.text: If you have nobody to hold the other end or tired of working on your knees , get this . I put a vise on a 3' X 2 ' piece of 5/8 ply as a portable work station for small jobs and repairs. For bigger jobs the product speaks for itself.
customer_reviews.author: Hungry Guy

product_meta.title: Rockwell RK9002 JawHorse Sheetmaster Portable Workstation
product_meta.description:
Rockwell RK9002 JawHorse Sheetmaster Portable Workstation

AMAZON.COM
The Rockwell RK9002 JawHorse Sheetmaster is the only workstation you’ll need thanks to its more than one ton of clamping force, rock-solid all-steel construction, portable folding design, and foot pedal for hands-free clamping and working. For additional expediency, its lock-release switch allows you to lock material—such as a full sheet of plywood—in place and easily release it with the flick of a switch, making the JawHorse Sheetmaster a convenient and reliable addition to the workshop or job site.




RK9002 JawHorse
Sheetmaster At a Glance:
 * Hold up to 48-inch sheets in one tool with hands-free clamping force
   
   
 * Quickly folds down to a portable 43 pounds with built-in straight-line wheels for easier portability
   
   
 * Dimensions: 39 inches by 39 inches by 34 inches standing; 29 inches by 14 inches by 13 inches folded
   
   
 * Backed by a five-year limited warranty


The Rockwell JawHorse Sheetmaster can function as a workbench, a vice, and a machine press (view larger).Powerful Clamping Potential
If you can lift it, you can clamp it. The JawHorse Sheetmaster's powerful clamping jaws allow you to securely clamp virtually anything, so you have hands-free access to safely complete your project. You can even clamp wide items like doors or full sheets of plywood thanks to the 49-inch clamping width. Simply set it, lock it, and clamp it.Versatile Workbench
Thanks to its flexible design, the JawHorse lets you get your projects up and off the ground at a comfortable working height. Simply clamp an ordinary piece of plywood into the JawHorse and you have a perfect workbench. You can even use it on the job site as a sturdy platform for miter saws, tile saws, and more. Plus, the tripod base gives exceptional all-terrain stability—and the front legs incorporate holes to allow for fastening for more permanent jobs.

Vice and Machine Press
Whether you're bending metal or straightening it, the JawHorse Sheetmaster's strength and stability allow you to be aggressive with your work. The JawHorse Sheetmaster is made of solid steel and has 10 times the clamping power of a regular vise. It also features the industrial pressing power of a one-ton machine press.

What's in the Box
One Rockwell RK9002 JawHorse Sheetmaster.



The JawHorse Sheetmaster is easily foldable—and at 43 pounds, it's easy to transport to the job site (click each to enlarge).

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Now you can support and clamp a full sheet of 8x4 plywood with just one tool. The Rockwell RK9002 JawHorse Sheetmaster is the ultimate worksite helper. Its hands-free operation make it easy to clamp and hold your work pieces. Let the sheetmaster do all the holding and stabilizing for you allowing free use of your hands for your tools instead of using your hands to stabilize your work. Non-marring grips on the jaws help protect your work. The Sheetmaster is heavy duty and supports up to 600 lbs. of weight with up to 1 ton of clamping force. When you are finished, fold it up for compact storage or for easy transport. The Rockwell Sheetmaster has scooter wheels to roll easily to and from the worksite. The rear leg doubles as a handle to make transport even easier. With the Rockwell JawHorse sheetmaster, just set it, lock it, and clamp your way to hands free support for your projects.

See more
feature_bullets: Clamp work pieces 0 to 49-inches, particularly 8x4 plywood sheets
Clamp up to 1 ton of force and supports a weight load up to 600 pounds
Versatile & hands-free workstation for clamping, supporting, and holding
Folds down quickly for storage and transport. Maximum clamping force 1 Metric Ton
Front scooter wheels for easy moving on all terrain even on rough ground
